title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Interior of a Temple"
title_raw: Stage Design: Interior of a Temple
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
inscribed:
On plinth of statue of woman committing suicide: SONO DISPERATA
On column base, left: CHI SI E/ DISPERATO/ IN AMOR/ COSI/ FENISCHA
On column base, right: COSI DEVE/ FINIRE/ CHI SI RITRO/ DISPERATO
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle: interior of temple with high vaults on columns with Italian inscriptions. Sculptural group in the middle with inscription. Sculptures of hanged men on the wall.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Stage Design: Interior of a Temple". Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-129.
